title: Thomas Hardy's romantic love as expressed in his five poems to emma
abstract: Love is an important element in men?s life. Love can be so inspiring to somebody even though the one that he loves dies as what happened between Hardy and Emma. The thesis writer is curious to know how Thomas Hardy?s reveals the theme of romantic love in his five poems to Emma by using a literary device namely imagery. The poems that are going to be analyzed are "After a Journey", "At Castle Boterel", "Beeny Cliff", "The Going", and "The Voice". Finally, from the use of imagery, it can be found out that Thomas Hardy has the theme of romantic love in his poems that romantic love includes passion, intimacy and reflects a high regard for the value of each other?s person.
